Summary I have more than 20 years of experience designing and developing software applications for Intel Corporation, and have successfully taken many projects through the full software development life-cycle. My areas of expertise include architecture design for large and complex business software applications, software reuse, software development life-cycles (especially agile methods), service-oriented architecture, enterprise architecture process and governance, project management and team leadership. I am also certified as an IT Master Architect by the Open Group. In my current role, I am focused on developing strategic and solution architectures, and roadmaps for Intel's Identity and Access Management platform. My primary goal is to be a technical leader. I want to develop high quality, leading edge solutions for my customers and work hard to ensure results are delivered on schedule, minimizing bureaucracy along the way. Experience Enterprise Architect Intel Corporation December 2007  – Present (7 years 9 months) Primarily responsible for developing the strategic architecture visions and roadmaps for large business problem domains. Recent engagements include developing architectures for Identity and Access Management (IAM), CRM solutions, Customer Master Data Management (MDM), User Registration and Profile Management, Product Issue Management, Application Lifecycle Management (ALM), SaaS and SOA reference architectures. Continued support for evolving Intel IT's Enterprise Architecture methodologies and tools. Lead Solution Architect Intel Corporation October 2003  –  November 2007  (4 years 2 months) Responsible for developing the solution architecture for many software applications across the Intel business landscape. This included engaging on many projects and programs to develop optimal architectural designs that maximize reuse of existings assets and minimize the total cost of ownership. Spent 2 years in EMEA region establishing architecture process and governance, and directing the solution architecture design across more than 30 projects. Upon returning to the US, spent time developing the architecture on several significant programs such as PLM and SOA. Other responsibilities included helping to establish the practice of Enterprise Architecture within Intel's IT organization. This involved the adoption of TOGAF ADM and E2AF. Internet Staff Manager Intel Corporation April 1999  –  October 2003  (4 years 7 months) Managed a large program using program management practices, which involved directing the work of more than 40 people to build a new scalable extranet server farm. This server farm was comprised of more than 100 servers and the flawless migration of more than 40 web-based applications used by thousands of users from the old environment to the new. Additionally, people managed a team of individual contributors responsible for the development, integration, deployment and support of core software capabilities hosted on Intel's supplier facing extranet, supplier.intel.com. This included implementing solutions such as user registration and entitlement, on-line collaboration and web portals. Senior Software Engineer Intel Corporation March 1996  –  March 1999  (3 years 1 month) Designed and implemented Intel's external (DMZ) internet user account management system, responsible for maintaining more than 1 million user accounts. Primary responsibility consisted of web page user interface implementation including support for delivering web pages in many different languages to enable users to log in, change their password, maintain their information and create a perception of a single login user experience across a large virtual mesh of heterogeneous computer systems. Also designed and implemented Intel's internal user account management system responsible for managing more than 500,000 accounts across hundreds of systems within Intel. Summary PROFESSIONAL SUMMARY: 
A senior Enterprise Architect in the Information Technology organization at Intel Corporation. Is very passionate about continuously improving business conditions and enabling business value. Brings a unique blend of strong technical and business acumen to help bridge the gaps between customer requirements/needs and IT Solutions. 
 
SUMMARY OF QUALIFICATIONS 
- Twenty three years’ work experience in Information Technology field. 
- Ability to evaluate complex business models, develop/define business processes, and propose solutions.  
- Ability to drive change in organizational behavior through the focus of business value, process improvements, and cost management. 
- Strong balance between customer service & technical skills. 
- Ability to manage virtual & cross-organizational teams to generate results. 
- Good communication skills, both verbal and written. Summary PROFESSIONAL SUMMARY:
